page.title: 15Swell Wold & Eyeford Hill
page.content: The absentee landlord of Swell Wold Farm owns land in the North Cotswolds which entitles him to hunt with the Heythrop Hunt. The land is let, half of which grows cereals, the other half is sub-let for sprout growing. The sprouts will be used to supply supermarkets and are therefore planted in batches so that they do not all crop at the same time. Eyeford Hill Farm was until 4 years ago a dairy farm. It now consists of 165 hectares of cereals, 60 hectares of permanent grass, 10 hectares of woodland, mainly deciduous. 400 trees were planted Spring 1985. Animals kept are 2 Blonde Aquitaine bulls, 14 Friesian cows with calves, 90 Freisian x Hereford cattle, 2 Jersey cows. Crops are wheat and barley and triticale, a new crop this year. There is a manager and one farm worker.
